bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, October 27, 1939

div1.p: Hench plans on meeting Moran in March 1940, and intends to visit Kean soon thereafter.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John J. Moran, October 27, 1939
div1.opener:
October 27, 1939
Mr. John J. Moran
Havana, Cuba
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
I appreciate very much your letter telling me
that General Kean will be glad to cooperate in the pre-
paration of the article on yellow fever. I am going to
write to him expressing the hope that I may be able to call
on him sometime in the not too distant future. I think
that might be much more satisfactory than to ask him to
answer a questionnaire. I should like to postpone this
until after I have perhaps had the privilege of discussing
the whole matter with you in Havana in March; although,
knowing that General Kean is now eighty years old we
mustn't wait too long.

In preparation for my own catechism of you
in March you might care to write down some notes and
comments which we can discuss, and I intend to set down
a list of questions sometime before I come which I can
discuss with you in detail.
div1.closer: Always, sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. psh:ds:if
